page.title: 03Churches in Wolsingham
page.content: There are four churches in Wolsingham. The{Anglican Church}of St Mary and St Stephen,rebuilt in the last century, dates back to the 12th century.The {Catholic Church}of St Thomas of Canterbury was built in 1854 and is linked to the church at Tow Law,four miles away.A{Methodist Chapel,}built in 1885 and the{Baptist Church,}opened in 1889,are both in the centre of the town. A recent survey showed that{17%}of the population attended the Anglican Church, while{6%}were Catholic and{5% were regular Chapelgoers.{31%}said they never attended any church. Anglicans and Methodists hold joint services at special times of the year and all Churches co_operate in charitable activities like{Christian {Aid.
